name: Vegan Peanut Butter Oatmeal Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: These Vegan Peanut Butter Oatmeal Chocolate Chip Cookies are melt in your mouth, delicious and hearty cookies. They need 1 Bowl, just 8 ingredients, and are ready within 30 Minutes. No Refined Sugar, Oilfree. Easily made Gluten-free. Vegan Soyfree Recipe.
recipeIngredient: 2 tbsp warmed non dairy milk (, such as almond, soy or coconut)
3/4 cup old fashioned oats (, use certified gluten-free if needed)
3/4 cup flour (, I use a mix of all purpose and wheat. Use Oat flour or gf blend for glutenfree)
1/3 cup vegan chocolate chips (, use dried fruit like raisins, currants, blueberries or cranberries for no chocolate)

recipeInstructions.text: Line a baking sheet with parchment. Preheat the oven to 350 deg F ( 180 C)
recipeInstructions.name: Line a baking sheet with parchment. Preheat the oven to 350 deg F ( 180 C)

recipeInstructions.text: Mix the peanut butter, maple, warmed non dairy milk and vanilla until smooth. it will take a minute to combine. (The warm milk will help the nut butter mix in more easily).
recipeInstructions.name: Mix the peanut butter, maple, warmed non dairy milk and vanilla until smooth. it will take a minute to combine. (The warm milk will help the nut butter mix in more easily).

recipeInstructions.text: Mix the baking soda and salt into 1/2 cup flour. Add the mixed flour and oats to the nut butter bowl and mix well. Add spices such as cinnamon or pumpkin pie spice if you wish
recipeInstructions.name: Mix the baking soda and salt into 1/2 cup flour. Add the mixed flour and oats to the nut butter bowl and mix well. Add spices such as cinnamon or pumpkin pie spice if you wish

recipeInstructions.text: Add more flour if the mixture is too sticky. Depends on the flour and the nut butter. I need 2 to 4 tbsp more * .Fold in the chocolate chips.
recipeInstructions.name: Add more flour if the mixture is too sticky. Depends on the flour and the nut butter. I need 2 to 4 tbsp more * .Fold in the chocolate chips.

recipeInstructions.text: Bring the dough together. Use a 1.5 tbsp cookie scooop and scoop onto parchment lined baking sheet.
recipeInstructions.name: Bring the dough together. Use a 1.5 tbsp cookie scooop and scoop onto parchment lined baking sheet.

recipeInstructions.text: Press each scoop down to flatten. Add some chocolate chips on top if needed.
recipeInstructions.name: Press each scoop down to flatten. Add some chocolate chips on top if needed.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake at 350 F for 12 to 14 mins, longer for crispier. Cool for 5 mins, then remove from the pan and cool completely.Store on the counter for upto 5 days. Refrigerate for freshness for upto 2 weeks.
